term.name: concretism
term.source: From English concrete: denoting a material thing or actual reality as opposed to an abstract quality, state, activity; derived from Latin concretus: grown together.
term.def: The view that, fundamentally, the only existents are concrete entities or material things (i.e., that there are no actual universals or non-material existents); similar to or even synonymous with &materialism; and &particularism;.
